bugs.title: HDMI audio not working with AMD RX 6700 graphics card
bugs.description:
**Environment:**
- OS: Arch Linux
- Kernel: 6.1.0-13
- Desktop: Cinnamon 5.8
- Affected Package: PipeWire (525.125.06)

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Install snd_hda_intel driver version 470.199.02
2. Reboot system
3. Open OBS Studio
4. Play WebM audio file
5. Listen for audio quality

**Expected Result:**
Audio plays clearly without distortion

**Actual Result:**
Crackling and popping sounds throughout playback

**Additional Information:**
- First noticed after system update on 2025-05-12
- Reproducibility: Random
- Workaround: Downgrade driver

bugs.title: System freeze when switching audio output to AMD HDMI
bugs.description:
**Environment:**
- OS: Pop!_OS 22.04
- Kernel: 5.19.0-50
- Desktop: GNOME 44
- Affected Package: amdgpu (6.5.0)

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Open system audio settings
2. Set output device to Behringer UMC22
3. Play audio file using Kdenlive
4. Suspend system using power menu
5. Resume system after 30 seconds

**Expected Result:**
Audio should resume playing normally after system wake

**Actual Result:**
No audio output, must manually restart Discord or switch audio device

**Additional Information:**
- First noticed after system update on 2025-05-21
- Reproducibility: Random
- Workaround: Disable hardware acceleration

bugs.title: No sound output after system suspend/resume on Behringer UMC22
bugs.description:
**Environment:**
- OS: Debian 12
- Kernel: 6.2.0-35
- Desktop: KDE Plasma 5.27
- Affected Package: PulseAudio (1.2.3)

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Open system audio settings
2. Set output device to Razer Kiyo
3. Play audio file using Audacity
4. Suspend system using power menu
5. Resume system after 30 seconds

**Expected Result:**
Audio should resume playing normally after system wake

**Actual Result:**
No audio output, must manually restart Chrome or switch audio device

**Additional Information:**
- First noticed after system update on 2025-04-28
- Reproducibility: Random
- Workaround: Switch to different codec

bugs.title: Audio device switching broken in Cinnamon 5.8 environment
bugs.description:

- Desktop: Cinnamon 5.8
- Affected Package: i915 (2.0.1)

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Open system audio settings
2. Set output device to NVIDIA HDMI
3. Play audio file using Firefox
4. Suspend system using power menu

Audio should resume playing normally after system wake

bugs.title: Screen recording fails with Kdenlive on Wayland
bugs.description:
**Environment:**
- OS: Debian 12
- Kernel: 6.1.0-13
- Desktop: XFCE 4.18
- Affected Package: snd_hda_intel (470.199.02)

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Boot system with NVIDIA RTX 3060 graphics
2. Update driver to version 470.199.02
3. Reboot system
4. Wait for display manager to load

**Expected Result:**
System boots to login screen normally

**Actual Result:**
Black screen after GRUB, must boot with nomodeset parameter

**Additional Information:**
- First noticed after system update on 2025-05-14
- Reproducibility: Always
- Workaround: None found

bugs.title: Hardware acceleration disabled after driver update
bugs.description:
**Environment:**
- OS: Fedora 38
- Kernel: 6.5.0-14
- Desktop: Cinnamon 5.8
- Affected Package: v4l2 (3.5.0)

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Download PulseAudio driver source
2. Run 'make && make install'
3. Load module with 'modprobe nouveau'
4. Check dmesg for errors

**Expected Result:**
Driver loads without errors

**Actual Result:**
Kernel panic with call trace in amdgpu_init function

**Additional Information:**
- First noticed after system update on 2025-05-22
- Reproducibility: Always
- Workaround: None found

bugs.title: Cannot play VP9 files after codec update
bugs.description:
**Environment:**
- OS: Fedora 38
- Kernel: 5.19.0-50
- Desktop: XFCE 4.18
- Affected Package: snd_hda_intel (2.0.1)

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Install gstreamer codec package
2. Open Audacity
3. Load MP3 media file
4. Attempt to play file

**Expected Result:**
Media file plays with hardware acceleration

**Actual Result:**
Playback fails with 'Unsupported codec' error

**Additional Information:**
- First noticed after system update on 2025-05-23
- Reproducibility: Intermittent (50%)
- Workaround: Disable hardware acceleration

- Kernel: 6.5.0-14
- Desktop: Cinnamon 5.8
- Affected Package: nvidia-525 (4.1.2)

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Open system audio settings
2. Set output device to Logitech C920
3. Play audio file using DaVinci Resolve
4. Suspend system using power menu
5. Resume system after 30 seconds

**Expected Result:**
Audio should resume playing normally after system wake

**Actual Result:**
No audio output, must manually restart Teams or switch audio device

**Additional Information:**
- First noticed after system update on 2025-04-25
- Reproducibility: Always
- Workaround: Switch to different codec

bugs.title: WebGL crashes in Chromium with AMD RX 6700 driver
bugs.description:
**Environment:**
- OS: Arch Linux
- Kernel: 6.5.0-14
- Desktop: KDE Plasma 5.27
- Affected Package: snd_hda_intel (6.5.0)

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Download nouveau driver source
2. Run 'make && make install'
3. Load module with 'modprobe ALSA'
4. Check dmesg for errors

**Expected Result:**
Driver loads without errors

**Actual Result:**
Kernel panic with call trace in PipeWire_init function

**Additional Information:**
- First noticed after system update on 2025-04-26
- Reproducibility: Intermittent (50%)
- Workaround: Switch to different codec

bugs.title: Kernel panic when loading nvidia-525 module
bugs.description:
**Environment:**
- OS: openSUSE Tumbleweed
- Kernel: 6.2.0-35
- Desktop: KDE Plasma 5.27
- Affected Package: i915 (2.0.1)

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Download nvidia-525 driver source
2. Run 'make && make install'
3. Load module with 'modprobe i915'
4. Check dmesg for errors

**Expected Result:**
Driver loads without errors

**Actual Result:**
Kernel panic with call trace in ALSA_init function

**Additional Information:**
- First noticed after system update on 2025-05-07
- Reproducibility: Intermittent (70%)
- Workaround: Switch to different codec

bugs.title: Video artifacts when decoding H.265/HEVC with gstreamer
bugs.description:
**Environment:**
- OS: Ubuntu 22.04
- Kernel: 6.5.0-14
- Desktop: GNOME 44
- Affected Package: nvidia-525 (3.5.0)

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Boot system with Intel Iris Xe graphics
2. Update driver to version 4.1.2
3. Reboot system
4. Wait for display manager to load

**Expected Result:**
System boots to login screen normally

**Actual Result:**
Black screen after GRUB, must boot with nomodeset parameter

**Additional Information:**
- First noticed after system update on 2025-05-03
- Reproducibility: Always
- Workaround: Switch to different codec

bugs.title: Low FPS on Behringer UMC22 webcam with PipeWire driver
bugs.description:
**Environment:**
- OS: Debian 12
- Kernel: 6.5.0-14
- Desktop: Cinnamon 5.8
- Affected Package: nvidia-525 (6.5.0)

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Connect Realtek ALC892 webcam via USB
2. Open Teams
3. Navigate to video settings
4. Select Razer Kiyo as video input
5. Start video preview

**Expected Result:**
Webcam feed displays normally

**Actual Result:**
Application shows 'No camera found' error

**Additional Information:**
- First noticed after system update on 2025-05-04
- Reproducibility: Intermittent (50%)
- Workaround: Switch to different codec

bugs.title: Green screen in video calls with Focusrite Scarlett webcam
bugs.description:
**Environment:**
- OS: Pop!_OS 22.04
- Kernel: 6.5.0-14
- Desktop: Cinnamon 5.8
- Affected Package: i915 (6.5.0)

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Install AMD RX 580 driver version 2.0.1
2. Enable hardware acceleration in Steam
3. Open video file in WebM format
4. Play video at fullscreen
5. Observe playback quality

**Expected Result:**
Smooth video playback without artifacts

**Actual Result:**
Screen tearing visible, especially during fast motion scenes

**Additional Information:**
- First noticed after system update on 2025-04-28
- Reproducibility: Random
- Workaround: Switch to different codec

bugs.title: Hardware acceleration disabled after kernel update
bugs.description:
**Environment:**
- OS: Arch Linux
- Kernel: 6.2.0-35
- Desktop: KDE Plasma 5.27
- Affected Package: nouveau (6.5.0)

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Download ALSA driver source
2. Run 'make && make install'
3. Load module with 'modprobe snd_hda_intel'
4. Check dmesg for errors

**Expected Result:**
Driver loads without errors

**Actual Result:**
Kernel panic with call trace in nvidia-525_init function

**Additional Information:**
- First noticed after system update on 2025-05-16
- Reproducibility: Always
- Workaround: Downgrade driver

bugs.title: System freeze when switching audio output to Razer Kiyo
bugs.description:
**Environment:**
- OS: Pop!_OS 22.04
- Kernel: 5.19.0-50
- Desktop: GNOME 44
- Affected Package: snd_hda_intel (3.5.0)

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Install v4l2 driver version 6.5.0
2. Reboot system
3. Open Audacity
4. Play MP3 audio file
5. Listen for audio quality

**Expected Result:**
Audio plays clearly without distortion

**Actual Result:**
Crackling and popping sounds throughout playback

**Additional Information:**
- First noticed after system update on 2025-05-16
- Reproducibility: Always
- Workaround: Disable hardware acceleration

bugs.title: Low FPS on Behringer UMC22 webcam with amdgpu driver
bugs.description:
**Environment:**
- OS: Pop!_OS 22.04
- Kernel: 6.1.0-13
- Desktop: XFCE 4.18
- Affected Package: ALSA (1.2.3)

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Install AMD RX 580 driver version 1.2.3
2. Enable hardware acceleration in Chrome
3. Open video file in FLAC format
4. Play video at fullscreen
5. Observe playback quality

**Expected Result:**
Smooth video playback without artifacts

**Actual Result:**
Screen tearing visible, especially during fast motion scenes

**Additional Information:**
- First noticed after system update on 2025-05-22
- Reproducibility: Intermittent (70%)
- Workaround: Disable hardware acceleration

bugs.title: Audio volume resets to 100% after reboot
bugs.description:
**Environment:**
- OS: openSUSE Tumbleweed
- Kernel: 5.15.0-88
- Desktop: GNOME 44
- Affected Package: ALSA (525.125.06)

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Open system audio settings
2. Set output device to Logitech C920
3. Play audio file using Teams
4. Suspend system using power menu
5. Resume system after 30 seconds

**Expected Result:**
Audio should resume playing normally after system wake

**Actual Result:**
No audio output, must manually restart Kdenlive or switch audio device

**Additional Information:**
- First noticed after system update on 2025-05-19
- Reproducibility: Random
- Workaround: Switch to different codec

bugs.title: Audio volume resets to 100% after reboot
bugs.description:
**Environment:**
- OS: Pop!_OS 22.04
- Kernel: 6.5.0-14
- Desktop: XFCE 4.18
- Affected Package: PipeWire (6.5.0)

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Install PipeWire driver version 6.5.0
2. Reboot system
3. Open GIMP
4. Play MKV audio file
5. Listen for audio quality

**Expected Result:**
Audio plays clearly without distortion

**Actual Result:**
Crackling and popping sounds throughout playback

**Additional Information:**
- First noticed after system update on 2025-04-24
- Reproducibility: Random
- Workaround: Switch to different codec
